entry.title: Lawyers: Millionaire Robert Durst illegally arrested
Robert Durst's whispered words could play 2 ways in murder case
entry.summary: LOS ANGELES -- The whispered words of Robert Durst recorded in an unguarded moment in a bathroom could come back to haunt him - or help him - as he faces a murder charge.

entry.title: Erroneous LAPD handwriting analysis set back Robert Durst probe, warrant claims
entry.summary: Durst himself may have pointed to the home, in a recording made while talking to himself after a tense interview with the makers of the six-part HBO documentary "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst," which concluded Sunday.

entry.summary: A car passes the building where millionaire Robert Durst lives hours before police began a search Tuesday, March 17, 2015, in Houston.

entry.title: Twists, turns mark bizarre life of Robert Durst
entry.summary: Durst's arrest came as HBO prepared to screen the finale of its six-part documentary, "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst."

entry.title: Police searching Houston home of millionaire Robert Durst
entry.summary: HOUSTON (AP) - Police on Tuesday were searching the Houston home of millionaire Robert Durst after his arrest over the weekend in New Orleans.

entry.title: AP confuses Robert Durst? with Limp Bizkit?s Fred Durst
entry.summary: "A Louisiana State Police trooper says millionaire Robert Durst has been booked on weapons charges in that state - on top of a first-degree murder charge lodged by Los Angeles authorities," the first line of the paragraph reads.

entry.title: AP confuses Robert Durst with Limp Bizkit singer Fred Durst
entry.summary: The correction, issued this morning, stated: "The Associated Press reported erroneously that Robert Durst is a member of a band. He is a real estate heir; Fred Durst is the former frontman of Limp Bizkit."

entry.title: Robert Durst mixed up in story as Fred Durst of Limp Bizkit
Prosecutor: Durst had nearly 150 grams of pot when arrested
entry.summary:
Robert Durst is transported from Orleans Parish Criminal District Court to the Orleans Parish Prison after his arraignment in New Orleans, Tuesday, March 17, 2015.

Law enforcement officers walk toward the building where Robert Durst owns some condominiums Tuesday, March 17, 2015, in Houston.

Seven officers spent hours Tuesday searching Durst's home in a 17-story condominium building in a posh Houston neighborhood.

In the documentary "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst" that just wrapped up, Durst mumbled about how he "killed them all," providing a dramatic kick to the end of the series.

entry.title: Robert Durst could face death penalty after being charged with murder
Will evidence in Robert Durst trial be 'Jinxed'?
entry.summary: A photo appearing in the HBO documentary "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst" shows writer Susan Berman and Robert Durst.

entry.title: Robert Durst charged with murder, movie confession likely admissible
entry.summary:
Durst, the subject of a six-part HBO documentary series called "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst," was picked up by a filmmaker's microphone apparently acknowledging his crimes and admitting that he was "caught."

Whether Durst's apparent confession will be admissible at trial would likely be the subject of a pre-trial hearing that would "certainly be the centerpiece of the legal battle," said Robert Mintz, a former federal prosecutor now at the McCarter & English law firm.

entry.title: Millionaire Robert Durst faces murder charge after broadcast
A documentary prompts a murder charge: The saga of millionaire Robert Durst continues
entry.summary: NEW ORLEANS - Robert Durst couldn't explain away similarities between his handwriting and a letter he said "only the killer could have written" that alerted police to his friend's shooting 15 years ago.

entry.title: Durst heir faces murder charge after documentary broadcast
entry.summary:
Durst was arrested in New Orleans on an extradition warrant to Los Angeles on Saturday, March 14, 2015.

Robert Durst, far right, photographed through fencing, is escorted into Orleans Parish Criminal District Court through a tunnel entrance, in New Orleans, Monday, March 16, 2015.

FILE - In this Jan. 28, 2015 file photo, director Andrew Jarecki attends the HBO documentary series premiere of "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst" in New York City.

This booking photo provided by the Orleans Parish Sheriff's Office shows Robert Durst, after his Saturday, March 14, 2015 arrest in New Orleans on an extradition warrant to Los Angeles.

Robert A. Durst's attorney Dick DeGuerin leaves Orleans Parish Criminal District Court in New Orleans, La.

Robert A. Durst's attorneys, including Dick DeGuerin, center, and William P. Gibbens, left, speak briefly after leaving Orleans Parish Criminal District Court in New Orleans, La.

entry.title: Millionaire Robert Durst faces murder charge after broadcast
entry.summary: The makers of "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst" said Durst rejected his lawyer's advice to stay quiet before granting two lengthy interviews.

entry.title: HBO Documentary 'The Jinx' Ends With Surprising Confession
entry.summary: ROBERT DURST: There it is.

entry.title: Robert Durst's attorney: Potential new charges may delay extradition
entry.summary: Durst is heard muttering that he "killed them all, of course," at the end of "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst."

entry.title: Straight from TV to jail: Robert Durst charged in killing
entry.summary:
Since his first wife vanished more than three decades ago, Robert A. Durst, the eccentric and estranged son of one of New York's most prominent real estate dynasties, has lived under the suspicious gaze of law enforcement officials in three states.

When prosecutors began pursuing new leads in his wife's disappearance in 2000, Robert Durst fled to Galveston, posing as a mute woman to rent a $300-a-month room in the Gulf Coast city.

entry.title: Robert Durst Heard Off-Camera In HBO Finale Of 'The Jinx' Saying He 'Killed Them All'
entry.summary: Durst participated in the documentary, giving an extensive interview to filmmaker Andrew Jarecki for "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst."

entry.title: Robert Durst, from documentary 'The Jinx', arrested on murder charge
entry.summary: New York: Robert Durst, the scion of a New York real estate family, has been arraigned in New Orleans after being arrested on first-degree murder charges in a killing 15 years ago in Los Angeles, law enforcement officials said.

entry.title: Robert Durst, from documentary 'The Jinx', arrested on murder charge
entry.summary: The sixth and final episode of the documentary, The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst was scheduled to air in the United States on Sunday night.

entry.title: Jinx doco star arrested for mob murder
entry.summary: "We are relieved and also grateful to everyone who assisted in the arrest of Robert Durst. We hope he will finally be held accountable for all he has done," said his brother, Douglas Durst, in a statement.

entry.title: Robert Durst Reportedly Arrested Because Of Evidence In 'The Jinx'
entry.summary: "Years in the making, their thorough research and dogged reporting reignited interest in Robert Durst's story with the public and law enforcement."

entry.title: New York real estate baron Durst arrested on LA murder warrant
entry.summary:
The investigation could be bolstered by new evidence shown for the first time in a six-part HBO documentary series about Durst called "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst," the New York Times said.

Robert Durst, who has lived in Texas after getting about $65 million from the settlement of a lawsuit he brought against family trusts, was charged in 2014 with urinating on a drugstore candy rack in Houston.

entry.title: New York property heir Robert Durst arrested on murder warrant
entry.summary: The arrest came on the eve the last episode of "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst," by filmmaker Andrew Jarecki.

entry.title: Robert Durst, subject of HBO series The Jinx, arrested on murder warrant
Robert Durst Arrested in New Orleans
